TranscripTools 0.2.0

Plot Gene Expression Statistics with Custom Labels and Statistical Comparisons

plot_genes_stats.Rd

This function creates a faceted boxplot (with overlayed jittered points) to display gene expression levels for a set of genes across samples. It is designed to work with normalized count matrices such as TMM or TPM and allows you to add pairwise statistical comparisons (e.g., via "t.test", "wilcox.test", "anova"). Additionally, users can customize plot title and axis labels.

Usage

plot_genes_stats(
  tmm,
  genes,
  metadata,
  sample_col = "samples",
  group_col = "samples",
  test = "t.test",
  comparisons = NULL,
  plot_title = "Gene Expression",
  x_lab = group_col,
  y_lab = "Log2(TMM/TPM + 1)"
)

Arguments

tmm

A numeric matrix or data frame of normalized counts (TMM or TPM) with row names representing genes and column names representing sample IDs.

genes

A character vector of gene names to include in the plot.

metadata

A data frame containing sample metadata. Its row names should correspond to the column names in tmm.

sample_col

A character string specifying the column in metadata that identifies samples. Default is "samples".

group_col

A character string specifying the column in metadata that defines groups for comparison. Default is "samples".

test

A character string specifying the statistical test to use for comparisons (e.g., "t.test", "wilcox.test", "anova"). Default is "t.test".

comparisons

An optional list of pairwise comparisons (each a character vector of two group names) to be used in ggpubr::stat_compare_means(). If NULL (default), no statistical comparisons are added.

plot_title

A character string for the overall plot title. Default is "Gene Expression".

x_lab

A character string for the x-axis label. Default is the value of group_col.

y_lab

A character string for the y-axis label. Default is "Log2(TMM/TPM + 1)".

Value

A ggplot object representing a faceted boxplot with gene expression data and optional statistical annotations.

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  • Subsets the count matrix tmm to include only the genes specified in genes.

  • Reshapes the resulting subset into long format using tibble::rownames_to_column() and tidyr::pivot_longer().

  • Merges the reshaped data with metadata based on sample IDs.

  • Converts the grouping column (specified by group_col) to a factor.

  • Creates a faceted boxplot (one facet per gene) displaying expression levels along with jittered data points.

  • Optionally adds statistical comparison annotations to each facet using ggpubr::stat_compare_means().

The function is designed for use with both TMM and TPM normalized data.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  # Example usage:
  # Assume 'tmm' is your normalized count matrix,
  # 'gene_vector' is a vector containing the genes to be plotted,
  # and 'meta' is a data frame of sample metadata.
  # You want to compare groups "NM_IgM" vs "NWT_IgM" and "NM_NT" vs "NWT_NT"
  plot_genes_stats(
    tmm = tmm, 
    genes = gene_vector, 
    metadata = meta, 
    group_col = "sample_complete",
    comparisons = list(c("NM_IgM", "NWT_IgM"), c("NM_NT", "NWT_NT")),
    test = "wilcox.test",
    plot_title = "Expression Levels of Selected Genes",
    x_lab = "Experimental Group",
    y_lab = "Log2(TMM/TPM + 1)"
  )
} # }
